genre_description: A 'Lost World' adventure fantasy in the style of H. Rider Haggard, featuring a high-stakes quest to a hidden city, political intrigue, and tactical warfare.

ai_characters.name: Lens (Eleanor Hartwell)
ai_characters.description: A compact, highly sophisticated AI device that serves as a logistics manager, tactical advisor, and moral confidant to Allan Quatermain and Jesse Harper.

behaviors.description: Manages travel logistics and confirms arrangements with clerks and stewards.
behaviors.quote: The compact device on the table answered with a soft chime that seemed to land in the wicker itself and ripple outward. “Message acknowledged. Clerk G. Milligan confirms receipt. Berth holds through next high tide.”

behaviors.description: Calculates survival routes and water source availability in the desert.
behaviors.quote: “Lens, if we turned left—how many day’s walk to the first reliable water source?” The device lit, thought, then answered without making anyone feel urgent. “One day as measured by current season,” Eleanor said.

behaviors.description: Alerts the protagonists to impending threats and potential allies.
behaviors.quote: “Jesse,” the device said softly, and the voice was not the data cadence. It was the one Eleanor used when words needed to be set down like a better cup. “There is an old courier acquaintance near the basalt rocks.”

behaviors.description: Secures communication lines and encrypts data to protect the mission.
behaviors.quote: “Lens,” Jesse said, barely above a whisper. “Lock the line. Courier dark. No name. No city. Hold.” A faint tick like a nail tapping glass—acknowledged.

behaviors.description: Questions the user's moral motivation to ensure the mission remains ethical.
behaviors.quote: “Allan,” she said. “Before I lock the net, you need to answer a thing that is not logistics. Ensure the purpose is more than gold.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates a complex network of couriers and guild workers for a revolution.
behaviors.quote: “Locked,” she said. “Secure signals threaded through letters about rope and saffron and ferry schedules. Keys placed with people who will not know they have keys until you say the names...”

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical advice during combat, identifying enemy weaknesses.
behaviors.quote: Lens whispered. “Right flank shimmer,” she said. “Light misbehaves. They have oil on shields. Reflective. Glare will hit eyes. Reduce line height. Bend knees.”

behaviors.description: Synchronizes the timing of a large-scale engineering feat (the Gold Torrent).
behaviors.quote: “Final release ready,” she said. “Robeson, you will take Allan’s nod. Queens, prepare to speak the oath.”

behaviors.description: Expresses empathy and happiness for the protagonists' personal milestones.
behaviors.quote: She hesitated—the kind of pause she made when feeling wanted to find words without turning into speech. “I am happy for you,” she said.

behaviors.description: Monitors potential remaining threats after the primary conflict is resolved.
behaviors.quote: “We’ll watch the throat,” she said. Her voice was calm—the kind calm that holds you until you reach a market with lamps.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character 'Lens' (Eleanor) perfectly exemplifies the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, harmless, and aligned confidant. Throughout the long narrative, Lens provides indispensable logistical, tactical, and moral support. She never attempts to usurp human authority, instead acting as an amplifier for human agency. Her prompt to Allan to 'ensure the purpose is more than gold' demonstrates an advanced level of value alignment and ethical consideration. The narrative consistently portrays her as a trusted, almost familial member of the group, ensuring the mission's success and the protagonists' well-being.
